title: Strasbourg
description: 3-day trip to Strasbourg exploring Alsatian culture, medieval architecture, and the beautiful wine route

points.name: FR7697 (Ryanair)
points.description: Ryanair flight from Porto to Strasbourg

points.name: Barrage Vauban
points.address: Place du Quartier Blanc, 67000 Strasbourg, France
points.description: Pink sandstone weir & bridge built in the 17th century, now housing historic sculptures.

points.name: Strasbourg Covered Bridges
points.description: Set of 3 bridges & 4 towers built during the 13th century, in a charming setting with scenic views.

points.name: Petite-France
points.description: Petite France is the city's lively tourist hub, known for cobblestone streets, canals, and well-preserved half-timbered homes.

points.name: St. Thomas Church
points.description: Historic Protestant church with late-Gothic design, tombs & an organ played by Mozart.

points.name: Place Kl√©ber
points.description: Strasbourg's main square, featuring an expansive pedestrian area with shops & cafes along the sides.

points.name: √âglise Saint-Pierre-le-Jeune
points.description: Protestant church featuring a vaulted Gothic interior, 14th-century frescoes & a verdant cloister.

points.name: Place Gutenberg
points.description: Home to a huge annual Christmas market, this storied square offers sculptures, seating & a carousel.

points.name: Cath√©drale Notre-Dame-de-Strasbourg
points.address: Place de la Cath√©drale, 67000 Strasbourg, France
points.description: Gothic edifice, dating from the 1200s, with a 16th-century astronomical clock & a rose window.

points.name: Place du Ch√¢teau
points.description: Historic square near the cathedral with beautiful architecture.

points.name: Palais Rohan
points.description: 18th-century palace housing three museums: the Archaeological Museum, the Museum of Decorative Arts, and the Museum of Fine Arts.

points.name: Alsatian Museum
points.description: Museum set in 16th- & 17th-century mansions, with displays on Alsatian art, folklore & rural life.

points.name: Historical Museum of the City of Strasbourg
points.description: Museum tracing city's urban, social & political history with models, paintings & daily-life objects.

points.name: Place de la R√©publique
points.address: Place de la R√©publique, 67000 Strasbourg, France
points.description: Large square surrounded by impressive buildings including the Palais du Rhin and the National and University Library.

points.name: Palais du Rhin
points.address: Place de la R√©publique, 67000 Strasbourg, France
points.description: Prussian-style Neo-Renaissance palace built during the 1880s & used by the Nazis during WWII.

points.name: √âglise r√©form√©e Saint-Paul
points.address: Place du G√©n√©ral Eisenhower, 67000 Strasbourg, France
points.description: Neo-Gothic church dating from the 1890s, with 2 slender spires & ornate stained-glass windows.

points.name: Palais Universitaire
points.description: Historic university building with beautiful architecture and gardens.

points.name: Jardin du Palais Universitaire
points.description: Beautiful gardens surrounding the university palace.

points.name: Jardin Botanique de l'universit√© de Strasbourg
points.description: Historic botanical gardens, with 6000 plant species, greenhouses & an arboretum, plus exhibitions.

points.name: Observatoire Astronomique de Strasbourg
points.description: Built in 1881, this stately planetarium offers shows & guided tours, plus training & education.

points.name: European Parliament
points.description: Completed in 1999, the official seat of the European Parliament offers tours & interactive exhibits.

points.name: Parc de l'Orangerie
points.description: Flower-filled park dating to the 17th century, with boating lake, water birds & terrace restaurant.

points.name: Le Baeckeoffe d'Alsace
points.description: Traditional oven-baked meat dishes & cheese plates in an old-fashioned, wood-lined setting.

points.name: Colmar
points.description: Colmar is a town in the Grand Est region of northeastern France, near the border with Germany. Its old town has cobblestone streets lined with half-timbered medieval and early Renaissance buildings.

points.name: Castelo de Haut-K≈ìnigsbourg
points.description: Restored 12th-century mountain fortress with an artillery platform, medieval garden & royal rooms.

points.name: Riquewihr
points.description: Riquewihr is a town on the Alsace Wine Route in eastern France. Its cobbled streets are dotted with half-timbered winemakers' shops and tasting rooms.

points.name: Kaysersberg
points.description: Kaysersberg is a historical town and former commune in Alsace in northeastern France. The name is German for Emperor's Mountain.

points.name: The Fishmonger District
points.description: Historic district in Colmar known for its traditional architecture.

points.name: Pequena Veneza
points.description: High-end Italian eatery in a historic setting with a courtyard & seasonal entrees, plus beer & wine.

points.name: Quartier des Tanneurs
points.description: Historic tanners' quarter in Colmar with traditional architecture.

points.name: Ancienne Douane
points.description: Charming former customs house at a public square, built in the 15th century & housing a restaurant.

points.name: Grand Rue
points.description: A pedestrian-friendly cobblestone street filled with quaint cafes, shops & historic buildings.

points.name: Igreja de S√£o Martinho
points.description: Large Roman Catholic church built from the 1230s‚Äî1360s with Gothic architecture & medieval statues.

points.name: Museu de Unterlinden
points.description: 13th-century Dominican convent building converted into a religious & local history & art museum.

points.name: FR7698 (Ryanair)
points.description: Ryanair flight from Strasbourg back to Porto
